article.Heading: Union Budget 2017-18: Govt allocates Rs 10000cr to recapitalise PSU banks; SBI up 3%
article.Summary: Prices of public sector banking stocks including State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank and Bank of Baroda jumped more than 3 percent intraday Wednesday as government has allocated Rs 10000 crore for recapitalisation of PSU banks.
article.Body:
Moneycontrol Bureau

Prices of public sector banking stocks including State Bank of India, Punjab National Bank and Bank of Baroda jumped more than 3 percent intraday Wednesday as government has allocated Rs 10000 crore for recapitalisation of PSU banks.

At 12:44 hrs Punjab National Bank was quoting at Rs 137.70, up 1.29 percent and Bank of Baroda was quoting at Rs 167.40, up 1.39 percent.

State Bank of India was quoting at Rs 263.50, 1.35 percent on the BSE.

Posted by Rakesh Patil
